thread.title: Girls Soccer: Prussak's golden goal advances Glen Ridge to the semifinals of the Essex County Tournament
thread.title_full: Girls Soccer: Prussak's golden goal advances Glen Ridge to the semifinals of the Essex County Tournament

title: Girls Soccer: Prussak's golden goal advances Glen Ridge to the semifinals of the Essex County Tournament
text:
Buy this photo Joe DiFranco/Staff Photographer Freshman Halinka Prussak is swarmed by her teammates after she nets the golden goal in overtime to push Glen Ridge past Columbia to advance to the semifinal of the Essex County Tournament. 
Girls Soccer 
The Glen Ridge girls' soccer team (No. 2 in the County) has advanced to the semifinals of the Essex County Tournament with a 2-1 overtime victory over No. 10 Columbia. 
In the first half the Ridgers fell behind 1-0 as Columbia believed they could mount the upset. 
However, the Ridgers had other plans when a few minutes later Colleen Grady delivered a long cross-kick towards a scramble of players in front of Columbia's net, with Tomison Kennedy emerging from the crowd to tuck the ball into the goal to tie the game at 1-1. 
Following the goal from Kennedy, the two teams played to a 1-1 tie at the end of regulation. 
In the opening minutes of overtime, freshman Halinka Prussak received a pass from the outside and one-touched the ball past the Columbia goalie to net the golden goal and advance the Ridgers to the semifinals of the County Tournament. 
"It was crazy, I didn't expect it to go in," said Prussak following the game. "It has been amazing and unreal to play with such a great team, it's so much fun." 
The Ridgers' semifinal opponent will be the winner of a Saturday game between No. 3 Montclair Kimberley Academy and No. 6 Caldwell. 
On Monday, the Ridgers finish up their regular season hosting a very strong Summit team from Union County. 
The semifinal will be held at Belleville High School on Wednesday Oct. 28.
